channel.title: Commands help
channel.description:
ok i added a starter
but only admins can use it
wtf??
help please?
[shadow=red,left]if (command.startsWith("starter")) { sendMessage("You got a starter!"); addItem(995,100000); [/shadow]
its a dodian server
devolution version 6

item.title: Commands help
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“illslayu, post:16, topic:160833”]ok i belive i can help im using v7 but this should help:
search in your client.java for : if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“help”))
and under that command paste your command(s)
explanation: the “help” command is a normal player command and yours is (propably) under the group of admin commands!
(this worked for me and this should work for you too
hope it helped![/quote]

Read the date before posting next time.

Read full topic

item.title: Commands help
item.dc:creator: @illslayu illslayu
item.description:
@illslayu wrote:

ok i belive i can help im using v7 but this should help:
search in your client.java for : if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“help”))
and under that command paste your command(s)
explanation: the “help” command is a normal player command and yours is (propably) under the group of admin commands!
(this worked for me and this should work for you too
hope it helped!

Read full topic

item.title: Commands help
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

[quote=“kniveslives, post:11, topic:160833”][quote author=kiwon link=topic=218865.msg1900119#msg1900119 date=1196068252]

i use this and my players can use only 1 time

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 70000); addItem(1039, 20); sendMessage("The starter packet for KILLARSCAPE players !"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); } }
[/quote]mother fuck dude

why the hell are you posting that shit twice??!?!?!

fucking spammer…

and read my damn problem

before you go posting crap about your starter command

cuz i dont give a shit about it k?

You need to calm the hell down, you aren’t going to get much help if you act like a total prick, grow up and quit PMS’ing at someone for trying to help, he obviously just mis-read the question, or didn’t understand it.[/quote]lmfao

hes an idiot

he posted twice

both times

he said some useless crap that i did not need…

wouldnt you get mad if some idiot came into your thread

and posted some crap twice

about something you already had and didnt need…

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 27, 2007, 11:10:15 PM[/size][hr][quote=“kiwon, post:8, topic:160833”][quote author=drask182 link=topic=218865.msg1900109#msg1900109 date=1196067846]
i use this and my players can use only 1 time

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 70000); addItem(1039, 20); sendMessage("The starter packet for KILLARSCAPE players !"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); } }
[/quote]mother fuck dude

why the hell are you posting that shit twice??!?!?!

fucking spammer…

and read my damn problem

before you go posting crap about your starter command

cuz i dont give a shit about it k?[/quote]that code gives me 3 errors…

o.o

=[

Read full topic

item.title: Commands help
item.dc:creator: @Devildreams54 Devildreams54
item.description:
@Devildreams54 wrote:

OK CAM DOWN

first. i realy dont now why yours dont work … but i would say del you starter cod and add a new one not m saying that you have to use mine but it works for me good.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 15000000); addItem(1187, 1); addItem(1712, 1); addItem(4087, 1); addItem(3140, 1); sendMessage("You have received the starter kit! !");1712 starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You already used starter you cant use twice Twat !"); } }

soz if it dont work for you

item.title: Commands help

item.description:

If you want it to be at a certain playerRight’s value, just do something like this;
else if(command.startsWith(“blah”) && playerRights > 0)
